title: Discourse-Based Elementary Mathematics Pedagogy Workshop to Bridge Inductive-Deductive Reasoning Gaps

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary mathematical concepts and educational experience (for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields)
context.additional_context: Workshop aimed at professionals in medical/legal/technical fields to acquire teaching methods that support elementary math learners' reasoning transitions. Blended learning environment combining actual classroom scenario analysis and digital tools

learning_goals: Learners will clearly distinguish between inductive and deductive reasoning in elementary mathematics contexts
Learners will design lessons that convert students' experiential reasoning into logical proofs using discourse interaction strategies
Learners will utilize didactic tools (e.g., pattern charts, abstract symbols) to justify propositions like "odd + odd = even" through deductive reasoning
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
